content: An incomplete version of a great game. Adverts don't work in multiplayer. I wish computer players could be added to multiplayer.

I really, really adore this board game and its mechanics and gameplay. Unfortunately the app suffers from multiple bugs, typos and a poor AI system. Worse than those things though is the bizarre dictionary. Otherwise obvious words to English speakers aren't counted in favor of three different spellings of a form of Hindu ghost (true story). Maybe the developer ran out of funds to continue improvements, who knows? Oh, sometimes the game will also be completely unavailable online. So that's fun.
Really good and fun. Dictionary is a little weird sometimes though and it would be better if you could think about your hand on other's turns.

I love this game! My only complaints are about online game play. The biggest problem is that once in a while all of the current online games I'm playing will disappear. It lasts for awhile and then they'll just reappear. I used to get notifications when it was my turn but now I don't. These are just suggestions: When it's not your turn, you can't open that game to see what you most recently did. There's also no record of the games that were finished so you can't see if you won or lost.

Excellent game, fun, challenging and lovingly created with an historical aesthetic. You can play online with other humans or against the computer, both modes are good. Only thing that is odd is some words are not allowed which I know are real words, and there is no way to suggest a word get added to the dictionary, that would be a nice feature.
Fun game to play with family and frienda

I love deckbuilder games and own this game in the physical card format. The game is great. It is scrabble mixed with star realms in a novel theme. There are some issues with the digital version gameplay. I would rather see the hands flow out in real time. The summary screens are annoying AF cuz you have to tap them away after each turn. Music is super awful. The best deck builder game so far in digital format is the ascension app. The game in this app should flow like it does in ascension.

This game is AMAZING!!! Scrabble meets Dominion. I am constantly learning, adapting, and experimenting. AI is great. You can adjust the difficulty to you liking. Pass and play is fantastic! We've been playing it every day for months!

Great version of a great game, with only one small caveat keeping it from a perfect score in digital form. Both Paperback and Hardback A.I. use words that are not allowed by the human players. Proper nouns are the biggest problems. It accepts it for them, but not the player. My wife and I have even tried using words that we saw the computer use and get scored, and we are not allowed. Other than that, both of these games are absolutely fantastic, especially for multiplayer with other humans!
Excellent word game, highly recommended
Excellent implementation of this great deckbuilder!
better for a tablet
Fun game.  Having an issue when playing against an AI - if the AI is not able to make a word, the game freezes.
Heads up it looks like the servers might have crashed last night. Lost my friend list and active games
Didn't work on my phone
replyContent:
What part doesn't work. Does it crash on starting the app, or can you get in and not be able to play. If you could give me more information. Maybe I could figure out the problem.
Thanks,
Jeff

content:
No doublt this is similar to Paperback. I like the mechanic for using any 
cards as wilds. The push your luck mechanic also work well. But the Genre 
cards are what break this game for me. Very often it becomes who can 
cumulate the same genre cards fastest win the game kind of scenario. 
Doesn't really matter if you spell any long impressive words because a 
3-letter word of the same genre can worth 10 stars. And if your opponent 
can spell 3 or 4 of those you lose. Other than that, I think it is a fun 
game and it is different enough from Paperback. But I think Paperback is 
more fair. By the way, can developer please add an undo function to buying 
ink please? Sometime I wanted to sell ink but pressed the wrong button for 
buying instead. Can't seems to find a way to undo that.

Great looking app. I'm a big fan of the paperback board game and wanted to 
test out the mechanics before taking the plunge on the physical copy. I'm 
having issues though when I zoom in on cards to read the fine print. When I 
use the zoom feature on opponents cards it will occasionally freeze the 
card data and there isn't a way to minimize it again. I have to close the 
game when this happens. It also happens during the purchasing phase. I'll 
pull up a cards stats and the try and do the same for another card and none 
of the cards on the market are responsive. I can still usually buy ink at 
this point, but usually it is best to just restart the app.
replyContent:
Hmm, when this happens again, can you look at your in-game logs by opening your menu. I send any errors that happen to show up in the logs. If you find something send me a screen shot. Mesisos@gmail.com
Thanks

content:
I like this game and I'm glad I purchased it. However, I cannot recommend 
it to others. There is a TON of unused display space yet the cards, the 
crux of the game, are tiny and hard to read. I don't have a tiny phone, but 
I don't have a phablet either, and the game is ultimately irritating to 
play because of the poor game board design.

I'm hugely impressed by this game and would rate it 5 stars if it weren't for the bugs.  After enjoying Paperback, I came to see how this game compares.  It has developed the basic concept of that game quite a lot.  It's quite amazing to see how a deck-building, strategic game can be created from the simple "make a word" concept.  The game has a few bugs but I've found the developers to be very quick in response.
replyContent: I found the bug causing the tutorial to stop working. There is a link in the extra screen that will bring you to a pdf of the rules. This is the link https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0906/5390/files/Hardback_Rulebook_OL.pdf?5020672487310797486 I will get this update out today.

content: Very nice.
Bug? Appears that Inked cards are coming from the player pile, rather than  the deck.   Edit: Thanks for the update.. appears I've been playing the actual card game incorrectly this whole time!
replyContent: Per the game rules, Inked cards should come from the player's personal deck. Are you seeing something different?

content: Fantastically done. Beautiful art, solid gameplay, and great implementation. My only gripe would be that I'd love an undo button.
Oh man, who designed this game? It's amazing!

Need to close game if not playing, will lag the phone while typing in 
another app.
replyContent: an update is rolling out that might fix your problem. I have done some optimizations. Let me know if your experience changes.
